item.description: About I am a postdoctoral researcher in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) at the University of Milano-Bicocca (Milan, Italy), working under the supervision of Prof. Bernardo Nipoti (DEMS, University of Milano-Bicocca). I received my PhD in Statistics at the Universiy of Padova (Padova, Italy) in 2022, supervised by Prof. Antonio Canale (Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Padova) and Prof. Michele Guindani (Department of Biostatistics, UCLA).

Contact Office 2092/b, second floor U7 building. Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) University of Milano-Bicocca Piazza dell’Ateneo Nuovo 1, 20126 Milan Email laura.dangelo@unimib.it

Publications D’Angelo L. and Canale A. (2023) Efficient posterior sampling for Bayesian Poisson regression. Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, 32(3), 917–926. Article - Citation D’Angelo L., Canale A., Yu Z. and Guindani M. (2023) Bayesian nonparametric analysis for the detection of spikes in noisy calcium imaging data. Biometrics, 79(2), 1370–1382. Article - Citation D’Angelo L. (2023) A comparison of computational approaches for posterior inference in Bayesian Poisson regression, in Book of Short Papers SIS 2023.

Statistical Modelling course Third year course of the B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence (Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia). A.A. 2023/2024, 1st semester. 6 CFU (32 hours lecture, 24 hours exercises). Communications 19/10/2023 Schedule for next week: 24/10 Tuesday 12.30 - 15.30 (3 hours) ONLINE. The class of Thursday 26/10 is CANCELED. Zoom link For online classes

Conference presentations Invited talk: “A Bayesian hierarchical mixture model for clustering Spotify’s songs and artists”; StaTalk 2023, Roma, Italy; September 15, 2023. Contributed talk: “A comparison of computational approaches for posterior inference in Bayesian Poisson regression”; SIS 2023, Ancona, Italy; June 21 – 23, 2023. Invited talk: “Bayesian nonparametric clustering of spatially-referenced spike train data”; SIS 2022, Caserta, Italy; June 22 – 24, 2022.
Teaching Statistical Modelling (A.A. 2023/2024) B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence. Inter-university project of the Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia.

item.title: Resume
item.description:
Current position Postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS), University of Milano-Bicocca.
Education PhD student in Statistical Science 10/2018 – 11/2021, University of Padova. Thesis title: Bayesian modeling of calcium imaging data. Supervisor: Prof. Antonio Canale. Co-supervisor: Prof. Michele Guindani.
Master’s Degree in Statistics 10/2015 – 11/2017, University of Padova.
